questions.question_text: Which two types of entities can be a part of a vRealize Orchestrator package? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Answer is A & C.
Proof: 
"Packages can contain workflows, actions, policies, configuration elements, or resources elements."
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Orchestrator/7.6/com.vmware.vrealize.orchestrator-using-ops-client.doc/GUID-AD1AC423-CC7D-4C0F-A358-E55F155A4C70.html

Answer is A and C

evidence:
https://pasteboard.co/IXCN8Df.jpg

choices.C: Stop and disable all IaaS Manager services.
choices.B: Stop and disable one of the DEM Worker services.
choices.A: Stop and disable the Management Agent service.
choices.D: Stop and disable one of the IaaS Manager services.

questions.question_text:
Catalog item requests are taking longer than usual to provision.
Upon reviewing the vRealize Automation instance in the environment, the IaaS Administrator discovers the following error:
//IMG//

Further investigation reveals that the IaaS Manager Service is active on more than one IaaS Manager Service server.
What can the administrator do to address this issue?

discussion.content:
It's correct. 

Update the link to 7.6: https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.6/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-7E54F8B9-9F76-4470-9B6F-6DAE5972E740.html
IMO, B is correct as the task expected is to add an end point to vRA.

Answer is D + Tenant Administrator

The user has permissions to perform the updates in vRealize Business for Cloud. However, the user must
have the Tenant Administrator role from vRealize Automation to add endpoints into
vRealize Business for Cloud.

Answer is D.
"If the user has to perform all administration tasks such as managing connections, managing public cloud account, updating reference database, assign the Business Management Administrator role to a user who has the Tenant Administration role."
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Business/7.6/vRBforCloud.install.doc/GUID-F181D445-DB2C-40F5-AEA8-1A444AFE9BDB.html

questions.question_text: Which role is required in vRealize Automation to add a vCenter endpoint to vRealize Business for Cloud?

discussion.content: c + E sounds good .. Default form layout is generated for you, with most of the blueprint components. The properties for every Blueprint component are placed on a different tab. You can delete unnecessary fields, reorder components, add validations and interactions between the components.

questions.question_text: When using the Generate Form option, what are two items for which custom form tabs are automatically created? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Each custom property defined on a blueprint
choices.D: Each custom property group defined on a blueprint
choices.A: Each network component defined on a blueprint
choices.E: Each virtual machine component defined on a blueprint
choices.B: Each disk that is associated with each virtual machine that is already defined in the blueprint
